com.jgaap.gui.generics
Class GradientIcon

java.lang.Object
  com.jgaap.gui.generics.GradientIcon
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.swing.Icon
public class GradientIcon
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.Icon

Simple class that allows for rectangular gradient icons.

Author:
Chuck Liddell

Constructor Detail

GradientIcon

public GradientIcon(int width,
                    int height,
                    int color)
Simple constructor that accepts color as a single integer value. Creates an opaque sRGB color with the specified combined RGB value consisting of the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7. The actual color used in rendering depends on finding the best match given the color space available for a particular output device. Alpha is defaulted to 255.

Parameters:
width - The desired width of the icon
height - The desired height of the icon
color - Integer value used to create the color of the icon

GradientIcon

public GradientIcon(int width,
                    int height,
                    java.awt.Color color)
Simple constructor that accepts a Color instance and uses it to draw the gradient.

Parameters:
width - The desired width of the icon
height - The desired height of the icon
color - The desired color of the icon

GradientIcon

public GradientIcon(int width,
                    int height,
                    int color,
                    float startIntensity,
                    float endIntensity)
Complex constructor that accepts several additional parameters. Start and end intensity settings should be a float value from 0.0f to 1.0f, where a higher number results in a brighter white at the top of the gradient and a darker black at the bottom of the gradient. Smaller intensities will produce softer color transitions in the gradient. For a description of how a Color is created from an integer,

Parameters:
width - The desired width of the icon
height - The desired height of the icon
color - The desired color of the icon, represented as an int value.
startIntensity - The intensity of the white at the top of the gradient. A high intensity will result in a harsher color change from the primary color to the white.
endIntensity - The intensity of the black at the bottom of the gradient. A high intensity will result in a harsher color change from the primary color to the black.
See Also:
GradientIcon(int height, int width, int color)

GradientIcon

public GradientIcon(int width,
                    int height,
                    java.awt.Color color,
                    float startIntensity,
                    float endIntensity)
Complex constructor that accepts several additional parameters. Start and end intensity settings should be a float value from 0.0f to 1.0f, where a higher number results in a brighter white at the top of the gradient and a darker black at the bottom of the gradient. Smaller intensities will produce softer color transitions in the gradient.

Parameters:
width - The desired width of the icon
height - The desired height of the icon
color - The desired color of the icon
startIntensity - The intensity of the white at the top of the gradient. A high intensity will result in a harsher color change from the primary color to the white.
endIntensity - The intensity of the black at the bottom of the gradient. A high intensity will result in a harsher color change from the primary color to the black.
